10 Method Details: The study utilized the German Internet Panel (GIP), which combines online survey advantages with offline sampling standards. 04 Objective: To investigate chunk recognition in musical sequences using a complex span task.
10 Method Details: The study used a complex span task involving musical sequences. Sequences were defined as a root note followed by two notes with distances of eight and nine semitones. Major triads were used for chunking. Participants performed two trials per condition, unaware of the sequence regularities. Trial order was randomized. The task included a preparatory phase with hand positioning, a preparatory melody, and eye tracker calibration. Eye tracking and MIDI data were recorded to analyze fixation patterns and accuracy. Future studies suggested using different tonal structures or computerized adaptive testing to avoid ceiling effects.

10 Method Details: The study employed a field experiment on Amazon's Mechanical Turk (mTurk) platform. Subjects were directed to an external website after deciding to work on a task. The website provided all relevant information for the task. The researchers explored the impact of workers discussing the task on mTurk forums by analyzing data from workers who completed the task before and after the forum discussion. To avoid the impression of an experiment, the researchers took measures to ensure workers were unaware of the experimental nature and potential wage rate changes. The study also examined the characteristics of workers who completed at least six pictures (and thus saw the treatment notification) versus those who exited the experiment earlier.

10 Method Details: The study uses Levelized Cost of Electricity (LCOE) and Levelized Return on Equity (LROE) as key metrics. Both metrics depend on capacity utilization rates and incorporate factors like corporate income taxes, debt, and depreciation.
